dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 5784 IH: Artificial Intelligence Wisdom for Innovative Small Enterprises Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Scholten (for herself and Mr. Downing) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Small Business

form.official-title: To amend the Small Business Act to help small business concerns critically evaluate artificial intelligence tools, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Artificial Intelligence Wisdom for Innovative Small Enterprises Act or the AI–WISE Act.

section.header: Artificial intelligence educational resources and modules for small business concerns

subsection.text: The Small Business Act (15 U.S.C. 631 et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating section 49 as section 50; and
by inserting after section 48 the following new section:

section.header: Artificial intelligence educational resources and modules for small business concerns

paragraph.text: establish and maintain educational resources and modules for small business concerns with information on artificial intelligence tools; and
make such educational resources and modules publicly available on an existing online learning platform of the Administration.

subsection.text: The educational resources and modules established under subsection (a) shall include, to the extent practicable, information on—

paragraph.text: how artificial intelligence models work, including the limits of the capabilities of such models, and how such limits affect the outputs of such tools;
how to determine if software outputs are generated with the use of artificial intelligence;
how to remain updated on the emergence, development, and technological maturation of artificial intelligence;
how to understand and remain updated on the policies, terms, and conditions applicable to users of artificial intelligence;
best practices in coordinating with third-party providers of artificial intelligence tools;
how to effectively identify, evaluate, and manage the risks of artificial intelligence;
how to ensure the privacy of user inputs to artificial intelligence tools;
how to retain human involvement in important decisions informed by recommendations made by artificial intelligence;

how to identify tasks and functions that artificial intelligence can reliably and effectively perform, including whether artificial intelligence can improve operations, productivity, or customer service; and
how to determine whether an artificial intelligence tool adequately fills a need and is worth adopting.

To the extent practicable, the Administrator shall ensure that the information contained in the educational resources and modules established under subsection (a) is factually accurate and current, including by consulting with—

subparagraph.text: the Director of the National Institute of Standards and Technology; and
the Advisory Working Group established under paragraph (2).

The Administrator shall establish a working group (in this paragraph referred to as the Advisory Working Group) with which the Administrator shall consult on an ongoing basis regarding the information contained in the educational resources and modules established under subsection (a).

The duties of the Advisory Working Group shall include the identification and recommendation of relevant information to the Administrator for inclusion in the educational resources and modules established under subsection (a).
The Advisory Working Group shall be comprised of the following members, who shall be selected by the Administrator:

clause.text: Individuals with demonstrated expertise in artificial intelligence, including—

subclause.text: not less than one individual from the private sector;
not less than one individual from academia;
not less than one individual from an organization with demonstrated expertise in ensuring artificial intelligence outputs—

item.text: are reliable, secure, transparent, and not used for illegal purposes; and

subclause.text: not less than one individual with demonstrated expertise in the creation of educational or professional development materials regarding artificial intelligence.

clause.text: Individuals with demonstrated expertise in outreach to small business concerns, including—

subclause.text: not less than one individual from each resource partner;
not less than one individual from a district office of the Administration; and
not less than one individual from an association representing small business concerns.

subparagraph.text: Any vacancy in the Advisory Working Group shall be filled in the same manner as the original appointment.
The requirements of chapter 10 of title 5, United States Code, shall not apply to the Advisory Working Group established under this paragraph.

paragraph.header: Incorporation of information in educational resources and modules
paragraph.text: In establishing and maintaining the educational resources and modules under subsection (a), the Administrator—

subparagraph.text: shall consider relevant, existing information developed by resource partners;
may consider relevant, existing information developed by private entities; and
may incorporate information described in subparagraphs (A) and (B) into such educational resources and modules.

paragraph.text: The Administrator shall coordinate with resource partners to disseminate information to raise the awareness of small business concerns about availability of the educational resources and modules established under subsection (a).

paragraph.header: Specialized and localized educational resource development
paragraph.text: Resource partners may develop specialized and localized training resources to more effectively disseminate the information in the educational resources and modules established under subsection (a), including by incorporating information on uses of artificial intelligence tools common to the community served by such resource partner.

subsection.text: The Administrator shall ensure that the information in the educational resources and modules established under subsection (a)—

paragraph.text: is actionable and presented in a manner that is easily comprehensible by small business concerns;
does not give preference to a particular artificial intelligence model or tool over similar such models or tools; and

does not give preference to an artificial intelligence model or tool developed by a specific entity or group of entities over an artificial intelligence model or tool developed by another entity or group of entities.

subsection.text: In this section, the term artificial intelligence has the meaning given such term in section 5002 of the William M. (Mac) Thornberry National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2021 (15 U.S.C. 9401).

The Administrator of the Small Business Administration shall establish the educational resources and modules required by section 49 of the Small Business Act (15 U.S.C. 631 et seq.), as added by this Act, not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.text: No additional amounts are authorized to carry out this Act or the amendments made by this Act.
